oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Forest Nursery Company Catalog Cover
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nurseries (Horticulture); Trees; Horticulture; Forests
Agriculture; Commercial catalogs; Nurseries (Horticulture); Ornamental plant industry; Trees; Gardening; Landscape gardening
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The cover of this nursery catalog highlights color images of the American elm and the Lombardy poplar trees. These images appear on top of a black and white background image of a forest.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Forest Nursery Co.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Forest Nursery Company was founded by J. H. H. Boyd in 1887. He located his wholesale nursery business in McMinnville in 1904 and specialized in forest and shade trees, evergreens, and ornamental shrubs. His sons James R. and Fernando C. Boyd assisted him and continued the business after his death in 1924. It is still vital today. J. H. H. Boyd is often referred to as the father of the nursery industry in Warren County, and Warren County is referred to as "The Nursery Capital of the World."
